thread.title: Punjab Elections 2017: Navjot Singh Sidhu calls elections ‘dharm yudh’, says ‘will give Rahul Gandhi great gift with Congress’ revival’
thread.title_full: Punjab Elections 2017: Navjot Singh Sidhu calls elections ‘dharm yudh’, says ‘will give Rahul Gandhi great gift with Congress’ revival’

author: FE Online
title: Punjab Elections 2017: Navjot Singh Sidhu calls elections ‘dharm yudh’, says ‘will give Rahul Gandhi great gift with Congress’ revival’
text:
Punjab assembly elections 2017 Punjab Elections 2017: Navjot Singh Sidhu calls elections ‘dharm yudh’, says ‘will give Rahul Gandhi great gift with Congress’ revival’ Punjab Elections 2017: Navjot Singh Sidhu calls elections ‘dharm yudh’, says ‘will give Rahul Gandhi great gift with Congress’ revival’ Punjab Elections 2017: "Very confident of our win, did door to door campaigns and got positive response about my mother and father."- Karan Singh By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: February 4, 2017 1:22 PM Congress leader Navjot Singh Singh outside the polling station in Amritsar. Source: ANI 
Newly appointed Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu visited the polling booth in Amritsar earlier today along with his wife Navjot Kaur Sidhu and son Karan Singh. Before entering the booth he said, “Will give Rahul Gandhi great gift with Congress’ revival,” after cating his vote Sidhu in an interview with the media outside the polling station said, “Is dharm yudh mei satya ki jeet hone wali hai; Hum sure hain ki sarkar Congress ki banegi; Yahan se Congress ke jhande mei danda lagega.” Karan Singh, son of Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu. Source: ANI 
Navjot Singh Sidhu’s son Karan Singh also met the media outside the polling station and said, “Very confident of our win, did door to door campaigns and got positive response about my mother and father.” 
You may als0 want to watch- 
Cricketer Harbhajan Singh also visited the polling station to cast his vote in Jalandhar along with his mother Avtar Kaur. In an interview with the media he said, “Pehle 2 parties the, ab 3 hai, kaafhi votes divert honge, par jo bhi jeete woh Punjab ko apne party se pehle rakhe.” 
Punjab Elections 2017 are being held on February 4, 2017 to select the 117 members for the Punjab Legislative Assembly. The results of the election will be announced on 11 March.
